headerDisplay: This plugin is currently experimental and under development.  Please report [bugs](https://github.com/dkerr64/homebridge-yolink/issues)

mqttPort.title: Port number for MQTT service at YoLink API server

userAccessId.title: User Access ID (replace with your ID from YoLink App)

secretKey.title: Secret Key (replace with your secret from YoLink App)
secretKey.description: Obtain credentials from the YoLink app on your mobile device. Settings->Account->Advanced Settings->User Access Credentials. If none exist use the (+) button to request credentials be generated for you. Copy down the UAID and Secret Key and enter in above fields.

refreshAfter.title: Refresh time for data from YoLink server
refreshAfter.description: Maximum number of seconds for cache data, after which we request an update from YoLink server. Defaults to just over 4 hours. For example, if you want to update at least once an hour, then set this to 3600. Zero (not recommended) means always retrieve from the server, maximum value is 86400 (24 hours).

verboseLog.title: Enable verbose logging
verboseLog.description: Sometimes it is helpful to log more detail than info but somewhat less than debug. This is that half-way. If enabled then verbose messages are logged as 'info' level, else logged as 'debug'.

liteLog.title: Suppress logging of every get status request
liteLog.description: Homebridge / HomeKit can make very frequent requests for device status.  This suppresses logging of every request (unless verbose logging is enabled).

allDevices.title: Load all devices / accessories by default
allDevices.description: This will load all devices whether an entry exists in the config file or not (see devices section below).  If set to false then only devices specifically listed in device section, with hide set to false, or devices of the Type(s) selected below, will load.

excludeTypes.title: When load all devices is selected, exclude devices of these types

includeTypes.title: When load all devices is not selected, include devices of these types

checkNewDeviceInterval.title: Time in seconds between checks for added or deleted devices
checkNewDeviceInterval.description: Time in seconds to check if a device has been added or removed from YoLink. Zero disables device update check, maximum accepted in user interface is 3600 seconds (1 hour).

doublePress.title: Time in milliseconds between button presses to consider as a double-press
doublePress.description: Time in milliseconds between button presses to consider as a double-press. Defaults to 800ms, zero disables double-press events, maximum accepted in user interface is 5000ms (5 seconds).

deviceTemperatures.title: Create temperature service for those devices that report this
deviceTemperatures.description: Some YoLink devices report temperature in addition to their main function. Currently these are LeakSensors, Vibration & Motion Sensors and Flex Fob. This will create a temperature sensor for those.

powerFailureSensorAs.title: Represent YoLink Power Failure Alarm as
powerFailureSensorAs.description: HomeKit does not have the concept of a power failure sensor so we much choose either an Outlet or Contact sensor to represent the YoLink device.

enableExperimental.title: Enable support for devices under development
enableExperimental.description: USE ONLY IF REQUESTED by plugin author to assist development

devices.description: Device specific configuration that can override global settings for a specific device.  Devices are identified by their YoLink Unique ID.

deviceId.title: Device Identifier
deviceId.description: You can find the Device ID in the Homebridge log, in the YoLink mobile app (as Device EUI) or in the Homebridge Config UI by clicking on an accessory's settings and copying the Serial Number field.

hide.title: Hide device from HomeKit
hide.description: Hide this device from Homebridge / HomeKit. You might want to do this to suppress the 'device not supported' warning message in the log. As there is no accessory type in HomeKit for a hub, you can set this to true for the YoLink hub.

name.title: Device Name
name.description: This will override the device name returned by YoLink for display in the Homebridge accessories page

refreshAfter.title: Refresh time for data from YoLink server (override global setting)

doublePress.title: Time in milliseconds between button presses to consider as a double-press

nOutlets.title: Number of outlets in a multi-outlet power strip (multiple USB ports count as one outlet). Must be between 1 and 8, defaults to 5 (YoLink smart power strip)

temperature.title: Create temperature service for this devices
temperature.description: Some YoLink devices report temperature in addition to their main function. Currently these are LeakSensors, Vibration & Motion Sensors and Flex Fob. This will create a temperature sensor for those.

controller.title: Garage Door or Finger controller device

timeout.title: Time in seconds that a garage door should take to open or close
timeout.description: When you open or close a garage door its status is set to 'opening' or 'closing' until the sensor reports that it is complete. If no report is received within this timeout period then the door state is reset to either 'open' or 'closed'. Defaults to 45 seconds.

garageDoors.description: Pair two devices together into a single Garage Door accessory. You can find the Device ID in the Homebridge log, in the YoLink mobile app (as Device EUI) or in the Homebridge Config UI by clicking on an accessory's settings and copying the Serial Number field.
